clues.clue: I was the first Indian Army officer to be promoted to the rank of field marshal.
My active military career spanned four decades and five wars, beginning with service in World War II.
Under my command, Indian forces conducted victorious campaigns against Pakistan in the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971, which led to the creation of Bangladesh in 1971.
Though I was a Parsi, my regiment '8 Gorkha Rifles' gave me the nickname - 'Sam Bahadur'.

You measure my life in hours and I serve you by expiring. 
I am quick when I am thin and slow when I am fat. 
The wind is my enemy.
Who am I?

First of first is first in you.
Second of you is twice in you.
First of last is last in you.
Who are you?

I have cities, but no houses.
I have mountains, but no trees.
I have rivers, but no water.
What am I?

answer: Mahatma Gandhi or Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi or Mohandas Gandhi

clues.clue:
I am the one on the right.
I was the youngest of my sibblings - 
two brothers, one sister, and two step sisters.
I studied law in London and became a Barrister at the age of 22.
I practiced law in South Africa before coming back to India.
This is my wife and I.
I started wearing dhoti and took up the cause of my fellow Indians after coming back to India.
What is seen in the middle of March and April that cannot be seen at the beginning or end of either month?

What word in the English language does the following: 
the first two letters signify a male, 
the first three letters signify a female, 
the first four letters signify a great, 
while the entire word signifies a great woman. 

What is the word?

I have keys, but no locks.
Space, and no rooms.
You can enter, but you cannot go outside.
What am I?
What disappears as soon as you say its name?
This belongs to you, but everyone else uses it.

What comes once in a minute,
twice in a moment,
but never in a thousand years?
I am a victory tower. My construction was started by Qutbuddin Aibak and my last floor was added by Firuz Shah Tuglaq

I am a historic and archaeological city in southern Jordan.
UNESCO has described me as 'one of the most precious cultural properties of our cultural heritage'.

I am 15th-century Inca citadel, located in southern Peru.
 I am referred to as the 'Lost City of the Incas'.

I link the U.S. city of San Francisco, California to the northern tip of the San Francisco Peninsula.
I have been declared one of the Wonders of the Modern World by the American Society of Civil Engineers.

I am carved by the Colorado River in Arizona, United States.
I am 277 miles (446 km) long, up to 18 miles (29 km) wide and over a mile deep.
